RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
                                                          MARION,IL  NH3- SITE


1.  FACILITY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY POLICY.

THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF SOUTHERN FS, INC  ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEP,ARTMENT, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE TO  PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.
.

2 THE  PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY WHICH IS LOCATED AT 1501 EAST DEYOUNG STREET MARION, IL, IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR SALE TO FARMERS.  ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION  AS A CROP NUTRIENT.THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSIST OF ONE STORAGE TANK (12,000 GALLONS), LOADING RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.  ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED FACILITY  EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MGT PERSONNEL AND AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS. 

THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAN BE STORED WOULD BE 180,000 POUNDS. THIS INCLUDES ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT COULD BE STORED IN NURSE TANKS.

3.THE WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIO.
   
  THIS FACILITY HAS DEVELOPED A WORST-CASE AND ALTERNATIVE-CASE SCENARIO. HOWEVER SINCE
  THIS IS SECURITY SENSITIVE INFORMATION IT HAS BEEN WITHHELD FROM THIS EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
  AS REQUIRED BY EPA REGULATIONS.

4.  THE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S   ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF " SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1", PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN STANDARDS  INSTITUTE, INC. AS ADOPTED BY THE STATE REGULATION AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OS

HA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA".  COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS AND ON-GOING TRAINING OF OUR EMPLOYEES MAKE UP OUR ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.


5.  FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.
 
 The following is a list of accidental releases in the past five years that have occurred at the facility:
We had an accidental release of 300 pounds of anhydrous ammonia on 6/14/2006.The entire facility was evacuated, there were no injuries. There were no off or on site damages and no off site evacuations. We had an accidental release of 25 pounds of anhydrous ammonia on 4/29/2007.There were 2 members of the general public who went to the hospitals out patient for treatment. There was not any off or on site evacuations, or off or on site damages.


6.   THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

THE FACILITY HAS:

     A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD, 29 CFR 1910.38;

     PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND THE COMMUNITY
     RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III   (EPCRA);

     IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE WILLIAMSON COUNTY  AND MARION FIRE DEPT AND THE WILLIAMSON COUNTY LEPC.

7.   PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

     SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ON-GOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS 
     ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO  
     SPECIFIC SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR  IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
